title: Children of Veterans Tuition Grant
summary: Undergraduate tuition assistance up to $2,800 per academic year for children of deceased or totally disabled Michigan veterans.

requirements.notes: Veteran must have died or became totally and permanently disabled as result of military service.

eligibilityNotes: Natural or adopted children ages 16-26 of Michigan veterans. Veteran must have died or become totally disabled from service. Full-time students: up to $2,800/year. Half-time: up to $1,400/year or actual tuition (whichever is less). Michigan residency required. Apply through Michigan Department of Treasury.

title: Michigan National Guard State Tuition Assistance Program (STAP)
summary: Tuition assistance up to $6,000 per academic year for active Michigan National Guard members.

requirements.notes: Must be active Guard member including traditional service (1 weekend/month, 2 weeks/year). Up to $600/credit hour.

eligibilityNotes: Available for public, private colleges, universities, vocational, technical, and trade schools in Michigan. This is a repayment program - members whose Post-9/11 GI Bill pays 100% of tuition/fees do not qualify. Contact Michigan National Guard Education Services.

title: Free State Parks Access for Disabled Veterans
summary: 100% permanently and totally disabled veterans receive free entry to Michigan state parks without purchasing Recreation Passport.

requirements.notes: Must have valid Michigan specialty license plate: DV, POW, Medal of Honor, or Congressional Medal of Honor.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans with qualifying specialty plates on Michigan registered vehicles receive free state parks entry. No Recreation Passport purchase required.

title: In-State Tuition for Veterans and Military-Connected Students
summary: Michigan universities extend in-state tuition rates to most military-connected students including veterans and dependents.

requirements.notes: Includes dependents using transferred benefits. Institution-specific policies apply.

eligibilityNotes: MSU and other Michigan institutions extend in-state rates to veterans, active duty, and dependents. Contact individual schools for specific policies and application procedures.

title: Disabled Veteran Property Tax Exemption
summary: Michigan provides a full property tax exemption for qualifying disabled veterans or their surviving spouses.

requirements.notes: Applies to the veteran's primary residence. Surviving spouses may remain eligible if they do not remarry.

eligibilityNotes: Veteran must be rated 100% service-connected and totally disabled by the VA. Apply through the local assessor with VA documentation. Unremarried surviving spouses may continue exemption.

title: Michigan Veterans Tuition Grant
summary: Need-based tuition assistance for eligible Michigan veterans attending approved colleges.

requirements.notes: Requires honorable service during a period of war and Michigan residency.

eligibilityNotes: Administered by the Michigan Department of Treasury. Covers tuition assistance, not housing or books.

title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses for Disabled Veterans
summary: Michigan offers free hunting and fishing licenses to qualifying disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Includes base licenses; some permits or stamps may still require payment.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans must provide VA documentation showing 100% service-connected disability or individually unemployable. Base hunting and fishing licenses are free.

title: Veteran Designation on Michigan Driver License / ID
summary: Eligible veterans may add a Veteran designation to a Michigan driver license or state ID.

requirements.notes: Requires proof of honorable service such as DD-214.

eligibilityNotes: Apply at a Secretary of State office with acceptable veteran documentation.

title: Michigan Veterans Homes
summary: State-operated veterans homes providing long-term care, skilled nursing, and assisted living services.

requirements.notes: Admission depends on care needs, eligibility determination, and bed availability.

eligibilityNotes: Michigan operates multiple veterans homes. Spouses may be eligible in certain circumstances. Contact Michigan Veterans Affairs Agency for locations and admission criteria.

title: Michigan Veterans Cemeteries
summary: State-operated veterans cemeteries offering burial options for eligible veterans and family members.

requirements.notes: Eligibility generally mirrors VA national cemetery eligibility.

eligibilityNotes: Includes multiple cemetery locations throughout Michigan. Pre-need eligibility is recommended. Contact Michigan Veterans Affairs Agency for details.
